It was either go with the PCs or face up to a circumstance that was anything but jovial.

descriptors.name: KIND
descriptors.description: It's always been easy for you to see things from the point of view of other people. That ability has made you sympathetic to what they really want or need. From your perspective, you're just applying the old proverb that "it's easier to catch flies with honey than with vinegar," but others simply see your behavior as kindness. Of course, being kind takes time, and yours is limited. You've learned that a small fraction of people don't deserve your time or kindness-true sadists, narcissists, and similar folk will only waste your energy. So you deal with them swiftly, saving your kindness for those who deserve it and can benefit from your attention.

characteristics.name: Emotionally Intuitive
characteristics.description: +2 to your Intellect Pool.

characteristics.name: Skill
characteristics.description: You know what it's like to go a mile in someone else's shoes. You're trained in all tasks related to pleasant social interaction and discerning the dispositions of others.

characteristics.name: Karma
characteristics.description: Sometimes, strangers just help you out. To gain the aid of a stranger, you must use a one action, ten-minute, or one-hour recovery roll (without gaining its healing benefit), and the GM determines the nature of the aid you gain. Usually, the act of kindness isn't enough to turn a bad situation completely around, but it may moderate a bad situation and lead to new opportunities. For example, if you are captured, a guard loosens your bonds slightly, brings you water, or delivers a message.

characteristics.name: Inability
characteristics.description: Being kind comes with a few risks. All tasks related to detecting falsehoods are hindered.

links: A PC needed your help, and you agreed to come along as a kindness.
You gave the wrong person access to your money, and now you need to make some back.
You're ready to take your benevolence on the road and help more people than you could if you didn't join the PCs.
Your job, which seemed like it would be personally rewarding, is the opposite. You join the PCs to escape the drudgery.

descriptors.name: LEARNED
descriptors.description: You have studied, either on your own or with an instructor. You know many things and are an expert on a few topics, such as history, biology, geography, mythology, nature, or any other area of study. Learned characters typically carry a few books around with them and spend their spare time reading.

characteristics.name: Smart
characteristics.description: +2 to your Intellect Pool.

characteristics.name: Skill
characteristics.description: You're trained in three areas of knowledge of your choice.

characteristics.name: Inability
characteristics.description: You have few social graces. Any task involving charm, persuasion, or etiquette is hindered.

characteristics.name: Additional Equipment
characteristics.description: You have two additional books on topics of your choice.

links: One of the other PCs asked you to come along because of your knowledge.
You need money to fund your studies.
You believed that the task might lead to important and interesting discoveries.
A colleague requested that you take part in the mission as a favor.

descriptors.name: LIZARDFOLK
descriptors.description: You are from a long line of fierce reptilian predators. You show your fangs and scales proudly. Your people survive and thrive in the wetlands, guarding their eggs, raising their hatchlings, and protecting their territory. City-builders may call you a savage and your culture primitive, but there is grace in your hunting, artistry in your crafting, joy in your songs, and reverence in your worship.

characteristics.name: Agile
characteristics.description: +2 to your Speed Pool.

characteristics.name: Skill
characteristics.description: You are trained in balancing, jumping, and swimming.

characteristics.name: Skill
characteristics.description: You are trained in hunting and tracking.

characteristics.name: Skill
characteristics.description: You are practiced in using javelins and spears.

characteristics.name: Scaly
characteristics.description: +1 to Armor.

characteristics.name: Inability
characteristics.description: Your slightly clawed hands make fine detail work difficult. You have an inability with picking locks, picking pockets, and other manual dexterity tasks (but not crafting).

characteristics.name: Additional Equipment
characteristics.description: You have a spear and a pair of javelins.

links: The other PCs were lost in your territory and you were sent to escort them out.
Something has been attacking your community and you want to find and destroy it.
You were exiled from your community and need to prove your worthiness before you can return to it.
You or your priest had a vision of you traveling with the other PCs.

descriptors.name: LUCKY
descriptors.description: You rely on chance and timely good luck to get you through many situations. When people say that someone was born under a lucky star, they mean you. When you try your hand at something new, no matter how unfamiliar the task is, as often as not you find a measure of success. Even when disaster strikes, it's rarely as bad as it could be. More often, small things seem to go your way, you win contests, and you're often in the right place at the right time.

characteristics.name: Luck Pool
characteristics.description: You have one additional Pool called Luck that begins with 3 points, and it has a maximum value of 3 points. When spending points from any other Pool, you can take one, some, or all of the points from your Luck Pool first. When you make a recovery roll to recover points to any other Pool, your Luck Pool is also refreshed by the same number of points. When your Luck Pool is at 0 points, it does not count against your damage track. Enabler.

characteristics.name: Advantage
characteristics.description: When you use 1 XP to reroll a d20 for any roll that affects only you, add 3 to the reroll.

links: Knowing that lucky people notice and take active advantage of opportunities, you became involved in your first adventure by choice.
You literally bumped into someone else on this adventure through sheer luck.
You found a briefcase lying alongside the road. It was battered, but inside you found a lot of strange documents that led you here.

Your luck saved you when you avoided a speeding vehicle by a fortuitous fall through an opening in the ground (a manhole, if in a modern setting). Beneath the ground, you found something you couldn't ignore.

descriptors.name: MAD
descriptors.description: You have delved too deeply into subjects people were not meant to know. You are knowledgeable in things beyond the scope of most, but this knowledge has come at a terrible price. You are likely in questionable physical shape and occasionally shake with nervous tics. You sometimes mutter to yourself without realizing it.

characteristics.name: Knowledgeable
characteristics.description: +4 to your Intellect Pool.

characteristics.name: Fits of Insight
characteristics.description: Whenever such knowledge is appropriate, the GM feeds you information although there is no clear explanation as to how you could know such a thing. This is up to the GM's discretion, but it should happen as often as once each session.

characteristics.name: Erratic Behavior
characteristics.description: You are prone to acting erratically or irrationally. When you are in the presence of a major discovery or subjected to great stress (such as a serious physical threat), the GM can introduce a GM intrusion that directs your next action without awarding XP. You can still pay 1 XP to refuse the intrusion. The GM's influence is the manifestation of your madness and thus is always something you would not likely do otherwise, but it is not directly, obviously harmful to you unless there are extenuating circumstances. (For example, if a foe suddenly leaps out of the darkness, you might spend the first round babbling incoherently or screaming the name of your first true love.)

characteristics.name: Skill
characteristics.description: You are trained in one area of knowledge (probably something weird or esoteric).

characteristics.name: Inability
characteristics.description: Your mind is quite fragile. Tasks to resist mental attacks are hindered.

links: Voices in your head told you to go.
You instigated the whole thing and convinced the others to join you.
One of the other PCs obtained a book of knowledge for you, and now you're repaying that favor by helping them with the task at hand.
You feel compelled by inexplicable intuition.

descriptors.name: MECHANICAL
descriptors.description: You have a special talent with machines of all kinds, and you're adept at understanding and, if need be, repairing them. Perhaps you're a bit of an inventor, creating new machines from time to time. You get called "techie," "tech," "mech," "gear-head," "motor-head," or any of a number of other nicknames. Mechanics usually wear practical work clothes and carry around a lot of tools.

characteristics.name: Smart
characteristics.description: +2 to your Intellect Pool.

characteristics.name: Skill
characteristics.description: You're trained in all actions involving identifying or understanding machines.

characteristics.name: Skill
characteristics.description: You're trained in all actions involving using, repairing, or crafting machines.

characteristics.name: Additional Equipment
characteristics.description: You start with a variety of machine tools.

links: While repairing a nearby machine, you overheard the other PCs talking.
You need money to buy tools and parts.
It was clear that the mission couldn't succeed without your skills and knowledge.
Another PC asked you to join them.

descriptors.name: MIGHTY
descriptors.description: You have a very impressive physique. Your strength, power, and very importance are superior. Whether you're truly the mightiest may be up for debate (and you may have a friendly rivalry about this with other superheroes), but there is no question that you are exceptional. These things make you confident, but you know that you have these physical gifts in order to perform heroic deeds, and unseemly conduct is beneath you.

characteristics.name: Very Powerful
characteristics.description: +4 to your Might Pool.

characteristics.name: Skill
characteristics.description: You're trained in all actions involving lifting and throwing things.

characteristics.name: Skill
characteristics.description: You're trained in Might defense tasks.

characteristics.name: Healthy
characteristics.description: Add 1 to the points you regain when you make a recovery roll.

links: You joined the other PCs because they would fail without your strength.
You believe this endeavor will earn you a lot of valor.
Another PC asked--rightly--for your help.
An authority figure told you to do this to show you the value of humility.

descriptors.name: MORLOCK
descriptors.description: You have lived your life deep underground in artificial bunkers, hidden from the world's destruction and the brutal scavengers that live above. As a morlock, you have a keen mind for the technology salvaged from the before-time. In fact, every morlock comes of age by fitting a piece of morlock technology to its body to provide enhancement and extend its life. This means that you are part flesh and part machine. Your skin is as pale as milk, except where it's been replaced with strips of metal and glowing circuits.

characteristics.name: Enhanced Intelligence
characteristics.description: +2 to your Intellect Pool.

characteristics.name: Cyborg Body
characteristics.description: +2 to your Might Pool and your Speed Pool.

characteristics.name: Partially Metallic
characteristics.description: +1 to Armor.

characteristics.name: Repair and Maintenance
characteristics.description: As an entity of living flesh and humming machinery, you must first succeed on a difficulty 2 repair task before making a recovery roll. On a failure, the recovery roll is not used; however, the normal rules for retrying apply, and you must use Effort on a new roll if you wish to try again. In addition to the normal options for using Effort, you can choose to use Effort to heal additional points to your Pools (each level of Effort healing an additional 2 points to your Pools if you succeed).

characteristics.name: Morlock Prejudice
characteristics.description: While among non-morlocks, all positive interaction tasks are hindered.

links: The PCs found you in a collapsed subterranean tunnel.
The other PCs encountered you exploring underground, and you convinced them to allow you to accompany them.
You were exiled from the morlock communities and needed help on the surface.
The only way to save the morlock community you hail from is to venture to the surface and find a mechanical part needed to repair a failing ancient system.

descriptors.name: MYSTERIOUS
descriptors.description: The dark figure lurking silently in the corner? That's you. No one really knows where you came from or what your motives are-you play things close to the vest. Your manner perplexes and confounds others, but that doesn't make you a poor friend or ally. You're just good at keeping things to yourself, moving about unseen, and concealing your presence and identity.

characteristics.name: Skill
characteristics.description: You are trained in all stealth tasks.

characteristics.name: Skill
characteristics.description: You are trained in resisting interrogation or tricks to get you to talk.

characteristics.name: Confounding
characteristics.description: You pull talents and abilities seemingly out of nowhere. You can attempt one task in which you have no training as if you were trained, attempt a task that you are trained in as if specialized, or gain a free level of Effort with a task that you are specialized in. This ability refreshes every time you make a recovery roll, but the uses never accumulate.

characteristics.name: Inability
characteristics.description: People never know where they stand with you. Any task involving getting people to believe or trust you is hindered.

links: You just showed up one day.
You convinced one of the other PCs that you had invaluable skills.
Some equally mysterious figure told you where to be and when (but not why) to join the group.
Something-a feeling, a dream-told you where to be and when to join the group.

descriptors.name: MYSTICAL
descriptors.description: You think of yourself as mystical, attuned with the mysterious and the paranormal. Your true talents lie with the supernatural. You likely have experience with ancient lore, and you can sense and wield the supernatural-though whether that means "magic," "psychic phenomena," or something else is up to you (and probably up to those around you as well). Mystical characters often wear jewelry, such as a ring or an amulet, or have tattoos or other marks that show their interests.

characteristics.name: Smart
characteristics.description: +2 to your Intellect Pool.

characteristics.name: Skill
characteristics.description: You're trained in all actions involving identifying or understanding the supernatural.

characteristics.name: Sense Magic
characteristics.description: You can sense whether the supernatural is active in situations where its presence is not obvious. You must study an object or location closely for a minute to get a feel for whether a mystical touch is at work.

characteristics.name: Spell
characteristics.description: You can perform Hedge Magic as a spell when you have a free hand and can pay the Intellect point cost.

characteristics.name: Inability
characteristics.description: You have a manner or an aura that others find a bit unnerving. Any task involving charm, persuasion, or deception is hindered.

links: A dream guided you to this point.
You need money to fund your studies.
You believed the mission would be a great way to learn more about the supernatural.
Various signs and portents led you here.

descriptors.name: NAIVE
descriptors.description: You've lived a sheltered life. Your childhood was safe and secure, so you didn't get a chance to learn much about the world-and even less chance to experience it. Whether you were training for something, had your nose in a book, or just were sequestered in a secluded place, you haven't done much, met many people, or seen many interesting things so far. That's probably going to change soon, but as you go forward into a larger world, you do so without some of the understanding that others possess about how it all works.

characteristics.name: Fresh
characteristics.description: You add +1 to your recovery rolls.

characteristics.name: Incorruptible
characteristics.description: You are trained in Intellect defense tasks and all tasks that involve resisting temptation.

characteristics.name: Skill
characteristics.description: You're wide-eyed. You are trained in perception tasks.

characteristics.name: Inability
characteristics.description: Any task that involves seeing through deceptions or determining someone's secret motive is hindered.

links: Someone told you that you should get involved.
You needed money, and this seemed like a good way to earn some.
You believed that you could learn a lot by joining the other PCs.
Sounded like fun.

descriptors.name: PERCEPTIVE
descriptors.description:
You miss little. You pick out the small details in the world around you and are skilled at making deductions from the information you find. Your talents make you an exceptional sleuth, a formidable scientist, or a talented scout.
As adept as you are at finding clues, you have no skill at picking up on social cues. You overlook an offense that your deductions give or how uncomfortable your scrutiny can make the people around you. You tend to dismiss others as being intellectual dwarfs compared to you, which avails you little when you need a favor.

characteristics.name: Smart
characteristics.description: +2 to your Intellect Pool.

characteristics.name: Skill
characteristics.description: You have an eye for detail. You are trained in any task that involves finding or noticing small details.

characteristics.name: Skill
characteristics.description: You know a little about everything. You are trained in any task that involves identifying objects or calling to mind a minor detail or bit of trivia.

characteristics.name: Skill
characteristics.description: Your skill at making deductions can be imposing. You are trained in any task that involves intimidating another creature.

characteristics.name: Inability
characteristics.description: Your confidence comes off as arrogance to people who don't know you. Any task involving positive social interactions is hindered.

characteristics.name: Additional Equipment
characteristics.description: You have a bag of light tools.

links: You overheard the other PCs discussing their mission and volunteered your services.
One of the PCs asked you to come along, believing that your talents would be invaluable to the mission.
You believe that the PCs' mission is somehow related to one of your investigations.
A third party recruited you to follow the PCs and see what they were up to.

descriptors.name: QUINTAR
descriptors.description: You are a quintar from the planet Quint. You are basically humanoid but taller, thinner, and blue skinned. Your hands end in three very long fingers. Quintar have five genders, but all quintar prefer to be addressed as female when communicating with more binary species. Human emotions and sexuality fascinate them, but not because they don't have such concepts-quintar emotions and sexuality are just very different from those of humans. In general, quintar are more cerebral than other species, valuing knowledge over all else. Quint is relatively Earthlike, with slightly less gravity but a slightly denser atmosphere.

characteristics.name: Cerebral
characteristics.description: +4 to your Intellect Pool.

characteristics.name: Skill
characteristics.description: You are trained in one type of knowledge task of your choice.

characteristics.name: Skill
characteristics.description: Quintar fascination with human behavior eases all interaction rolls (pleasant or not) with humans.

characteristics.name: Difficult Rest
characteristics.description: Quintar subtract 2 from all recovery rolls (minimum 1).

descriptors.name: RESILIENT
descriptors.description: You can take a lot of punishment, both physically and mentally, and still come back for more. It takes a lot to put you down. Neither physical nor mental shocks or damage have a lasting effect. You're tough to faze. Unflappable. Unstoppable.

characteristics.name: Resistant
characteristics.description: +2 to your Might Pool, and +2 to your Intellect Pool.

characteristics.name: Recover
characteristics.description: You can make an extra recovery roll each day. This roll is just one action. So you can make two recovery rolls that each take one action, one roll that takes ten minutes, a fourth roll that takes one hour, and a fifth roll that requires ten hours of rest.

characteristics.name: Skill
characteristics.description: You are trained in Might defense tasks.

characteristics.name: Skill
characteristics.description: You are trained in Intellect defense tasks.

characteristics.name: Inability
characteristics.description: You're hardy but not necessarily strong. Any task involving moving, bending, or breaking things is hindered.

characteristics.name: Inability
characteristics.description: You have a lot of willpower and mental fortitude, but you're not necessarily smart. Any task involving knowledge or figuring out problems or puzzles is hindered.

links: You saw that the PCs clearly need someone like you to help them out.
Someone asked you to watch over one of the PCs in particular, and you agreed.
You are bored and desperately in need of a challenge.
You lost a bet-unfairly, you think-and had to take someone's place on this mission.

descriptors.name: RISK-TAKING
descriptors.description: It's part of your nature to question what others think can't or shouldn't be done. You're not insane, of course-you wouldn't attempt to leap across a mile-wide chasm just because you were dared. There's impossible and then there's the just barely possible. You like to push the latter further than others, because it gives you a rush of satisfaction and pleasure when you succeed. The more you succeed, the more you find yourself looking for that next risky challenge to try yourself against.

characteristics.name: Nimble
characteristics.description: +4 to your Speed Pool.

characteristics.name: Skill
characteristics.description: You're adept at leveraging risk, and you are trained in tasks that involve some element of chance, such as playing games or choosing between two or three apparently equal options.

characteristics.name: Pressing Your Luck
characteristics.description: You can choose to automatically succeed on one task without rolling, as long as the task's difficulty is no higher than 6. When you do so, however, you also trigger a GM intrusion as if you had rolled a 1. The intrusion doesn't invalidate the success, but it probably qualifies it in some fashion. You can do this one time, although the ability renews each time you make a ten-hour recovery roll.

characteristics.name: Inability
characteristics.description: You may be nimble, but you're not sneaky. Tasks related to sneaking and staying quiet are hindered.

links: It seemed like there were equal odds that the other PCs wouldn't succeed, which sounded good to you.
You think the tasks ahead will present you with unique and fulfilling challenges.
One of your biggest risks failed to go your way, and you need money to help pay that debt.
You bragged that you never saw a risk you didn't like, which is how you reached your current point.

descriptors.name: ROACH
descriptors.description: You are born of a species of evolved insects once called "cockroach," but that is far in the past. Radiation and forced evolution have radically increased your size, shape, and ability to think. Your exoskeleton mimics the shape of a human being, though not perfectly. When you move about human society, shadows and cloaks are your ally if you wish to pass unnoticed. When those of your kind are discovered, it usually goes poorly for someone. You, however, have a wandering spirit and seek to explore the fallen world and find a new way forward.

characteristics.name: Scuttler
characteristics.description: Your Speed Edge increases by 1.

characteristics.name: Sense by Scent
characteristics.description: You can sense your environment even in total darkness.

characteristics.name: Cling
characteristics.description: You can move an immediate distance each round on walls or clinging to the ceiling.

characteristics.name: Carapace
characteristics.description: +1 to Armor.

characteristics.name: Glide
characteristics.description: You can extend small wings from your carapace that grant an asset in jumping tasks and allow you to fall up to a short distance without taking damage.

characteristics.name: Skill
characteristics.description: You are trained in disguise tasks.

characteristics.name: Inability
characteristics.description: You are susceptible to disease and poison. Defense rolls against disease or poison are hindered.

characteristics.name: Inability
characteristics.description: You mimic a human, but you are not as fierce. Tasks involving combat- including attack and defense rolls-are hindered.

characteristics.name: Insect Prejudice
characteristics.description: While among non-roaches, all positive interaction tasks are hindered.

links: The PCs didn't realize what you were when they asked for your help.
You've managed to hide your roach ancestry so well that everyone thinks you are like them.
You are the last of your kind.
You have a secret agenda, and the PCs were gullible enough to let you come along.

descriptors.name: RUGGED
descriptors.description: You're a nature lover accustomed to living rough, pitting your wits against the elements. Most likely, you're a skilled hunter, gatherer, or naturalist. Years of living in the wild have left their mark with a worn countenance, wild hair, or scars. Your clothing is probably much less refined than the garments worn by city dwellers.

characteristics.name: Skill
characteristics.description: You're trained in all tasks involving climbing, jumping, running, and swimming.

characteristics.name: Skill
characteristics.description: You're trained in all tasks involving training, riding, or placating natural animals.

characteristics.name: Skill
characteristics.description: You're trained in all tasks involving identifying or using natural plants.

characteristics.name: Inability
characteristics.description: You have no social graces and prefer animals to people. Any task involving charm, persuasion, etiquette, or deception is hindered.

characteristics.name: Additional Equipment
characteristics.description: You carry an explorer's pack with rope, two days' rations, a bedroll, and other tools needed for outdoor survival.

links: Against your better judgment, you joined the other PCs because you saw that they were in danger.
One of the other PCs convinced you that joining the group would be in your best interests.
You're afraid of what might happen if the other PCs fail.
There is reward involved, and you need the money.

descriptors.name: SENSATIONAL
descriptors.description: The public and the press like you. Maybe you're photogenic, or you're inherently nice, or you have really good luck with journalists. Whatever the cause of it, you're the darling of the media, and whenever you're seen in public, you generate a lot of positive interest and excitement. (If you don't have a secret identity, this attention probably also carries over to your day job, which is a mixed blessing.) People know that you're a hero and that they can count on you to do the right thing--fighting crime, battling injustice, punching evil robots, that kind of stuff. Sometimes being in the public eye so much can be wearying or even a burden, but you know how to use your reputation to set a good example and make the world a better place.

characteristics.name: Versatile
characteristics.description: You get 4 additional points to divide among your stat Pools.

characteristics.name: Skill
characteristics.description: You're trained in positive social interactions.

characteristics.name: Skill
characteristics.description: You're trained in one skill relating to your current or past career, such as computers, journalism, law, machinery, or medicine.

characteristics.name: Popular
characteristics.description: The GM can introduce a GM intrusion on you, based on your fame and the public's perception of you, without awarding you any XP (as if you had rolled a 1 on a d20 roll). However, if this happens, 50 percent of the time, your reputation works to your advantage. Rather than hurting you (much), it helps you, or it hurts your enemies. You get spotted by a guard, but they're dumbstruck for a moment because you're even more impressive in person than you are on TV. You attract a crowd of fans, but they slow down the fleeing villain you're trying to catch. A photographer pesters you for a photo and a quote, but their camera catches something interesting in the background. You and the GM should work together to determine the details. If the GM wishes, they can use GM intrusions based on your fame normally (awarding XP).

links: You're related to one of the other superhero PCs, and decided to help out because of family.
The other PCs relied on your positive reputation to untangle them from a public relations problem, and they invited you along out of gratitude.
The media specifically called you out to fix this problem.
A supervillain chose to make a scene in the hopes of drawing you out.

descriptors.name: SHARP-EYED
descriptors.description: You're perceptive and well aware of your surroundings. You notice the little details and remember them. You can be difficult to surprise.

characteristics.name: Skill
characteristics.description: You're trained in initiative actions.

characteristics.name: Skill
characteristics.description: You're trained in perception actions.

characteristics.name: Find the Flaw
characteristics.description: If an opponent has a straightforward weakness (takes extra damage from fire, can't see out of their left eye, and so on), the GM will tell you what it is.

links: You heard about what was going on, saw a flaw in the other PCs' plan, and joined up to help them out.
You noticed that the PCs have a foe (or at least a tail) they weren't aware of.
You saw that the other PCs were up to something interesting and got involved.
You've been noticing some strange things going on, and this all appears related.

descriptors.name: SKEPTICAL
descriptors.description: You possess a questioning attitude regarding claims that are often taken for granted by others. You're not necessarily a "doubting Thomas" (a skeptic who refuses to believe anything without direct personal experience), but you've often benefited from questioning the statements, opinions, and received knowledge presented to you by others.

characteristics.name: Insightful
characteristics.description: +2 to your Intellect Pool.

characteristics.name: Skill
characteristics.description: You're trained in identifying.

characteristics.name: Skill
characteristics.description: You're trained in all actions that involve seeing through a trick, an illusion, a rhetorical ruse designed to evade the issue, or a lie. For example, you're better at keeping your eye on the cup containing the hidden ball, sensing an illusion, or realizing if someone is lying to you (but only if you specifically concentrate and use this skill).

links: You overheard other PCs holding forth on a topic with an opinion you were quite skeptical about, so you decided to approach the group and ask for proof.
You were following one of the other PCs because you were suspicious of him, which brought you into the action.
Your theory about the nonexistence of the supernatural can be invalidated only by your own senses, so you came along.
You need money to fund your research.

descriptors.name: STEALTHY
descriptors.description: You're sneaky, slippery, and fast. These talents help you hide, move quietly, and pull off tricks that require sleight of hand. Most likely, you're wiry and small. However, you're not much of a sprinter-you're more dexterous than fleet of foot.

characteristics.name: Quick
characteristics.description: +2 to your Speed Pool.

characteristics.name: Skill
characteristics.description: You're trained in all stealth tasks.

characteristics.name: Skill
characteristics.description: You're trained in all interactions involving lies or trickery.

characteristics.name: Skill
characteristics.description: You're trained in all special abilities involving illusions or trickery.

characteristics.name: Inability
characteristics.description: You're sneaky but not fast. All movement-related tasks are hindered.

links: You attempted to steal from one of the other PCs. That character caught you and forced you to come along with them.
You were tailing one of the other PCs for reasons of your own, which brought you into the action.
An NPC employer secretly paid you to get involved.
You overheard the other PCs talking about a topic that interested you, so you decided to approach the group.

descriptors.name: STRONG
descriptors.description: You're extremely strong and physically powerful, and you use these qualities well, whether through violence or feats of prowess. You likely have a brawny build and impressive muscles.

characteristics.name: Very Powerful
characteristics.description: +4 to your Might Pool.

characteristics.name: Skill
characteristics.description: You're trained in all actions involving breaking inanimate objects.

characteristics.name: Skill
characteristics.description: You're trained in all jumping actions.

characteristics.name: Additional Equipment
characteristics.description: You have an extra medium weapon or heavy weapon.

links: Against your better judgment, you joined the other PCs because you saw that they were in danger.
One of the other PCs convinced you that joining the group would be in your best interests.
You're afraid of what might happen if the other PCs fail.
There is reward involved, and you need the money.

descriptors.name: STRONG-WILLED
descriptors.description: You're tough-minded, willful, and independent. No one can talk you into anything or change your mind when you don't want it changed. This quality doesn't necessarily make you smart, but it does make you a bastion of willpower and resolve. You likely dress and act with unique style and flair, not caring what others think.

characteristics.name: Willful
characteristics.description: +4 to your Intellect Pool.

characteristics.name: Skill
characteristics.description: You're trained in resisting mental effects.

characteristics.name: Skill
characteristics.description: You're trained in tasks requiring incredible focus or concentration.

characteristics.name: Inability
characteristics.description: Willful doesn't mean brilliant. Any task that involves figuring out puzzles or problems, memorizing things, or using lore is hindered.

links: Against your better judgment, you joined the other PCs because you saw that they were in danger.
One of the other PCs convinced you that joining the group would be in your best interests.
You're afraid of what might happen if the other PCs fail.
There is reward involved, and you need the money.

descriptors.name: SWIFT
descriptors.description: You move quickly, able to sprint in short bursts and work with your hands with dexterity. You're great at crossing distances quickly but not always smoothly. You are likely slim and muscular.

characteristics.name: Fast
characteristics.description: +4 to your Speed Pool.

characteristics.name: Skill
characteristics.description: You're trained in initiative actions (to determine who goes first in combat).

characteristics.name: Skill
characteristics.description: You're trained in running actions.

characteristics.name: Inability
characteristics.description: You're fast but not necessarily graceful. Any task involving balance is hindered.

links: Against your better judgment, you joined the other PCs because you saw that they were in danger.
One of the other PCs convinced you that joining the group would be in your best interests.
You're afraid of what might happen if the other PCs fail.
There is reward involved, and you need the money.

descriptors.name: TONGUE-TIED
descriptors.description: You've never been much of a talker. When forced to interact with others, you never think of the right thing to say-words fail you entirely, or they come out all wrong. You often end up saying precisely the wrong thing and insult someone unintentionally. Most of the time, you just keep mum. This makes you a listener instead-a careful observer. It also means that you're better at doing things than talking about them. You're quick to take action.

characteristics.name: Actions, Not Words
characteristics.description: +2 to your Might Pool, and +2 to your Speed Pool.

characteristics.name: Skill
characteristics.description: You are trained in perception.

characteristics.name: Skill
characteristics.description: You are trained in initiative (unless it's a social situation).

characteristics.name: Inability
characteristics.description: All tasks relating to social interaction are hindered.

characteristics.name: Inability
characteristics.description: All tasks involving verbal communication or relaying information are hindered.

links: You just tagged along and no one told you to leave.
You saw something important the other PCs did not and (with some effort) managed to relate it to them.
You intervened to save one of the other PCs when they were in danger.
One of the other PCs recruited you for your talents.

descriptors.name: TOUGH
descriptors.description: You're strong and can take a lot of physical punishment. You might have a large frame and a square jaw. Tough characters frequently have visible scars.

characteristics.name: Resilient
characteristics.description: +1 to Armor.

characteristics.name: Healthy
characteristics.description: Add 1 to the points you regain when you make a recovery roll.

characteristics.name: Skill
characteristics.description: You're trained in Might defense actions.

characteristics.name: Additional Equipment
characteristics.description: You have an extra light weapon.

links: You're acting as a bodyguard for one of the other PCs.
One of the PCs is your sibling, and you came along to watch out for them.
You need money because your family is in debt.
You stepped in to defend one of the PCs when that character was threatened. While talking to them afterward, you heard about the group's task.

descriptors.name: UNCANNY
descriptors.description: There's something unusual about you, and it makes other people a little uncomfortable. You know you're exceptional--gifted, even--and being a bit odd doesn't make you any less of a person. This uncanny element is a part of you, in your blood, in your DNA. You can't help it, but you won't apologize for it. You feel comfortable around other people with similar strangeness, people who've experienced the same prejudice that you have; these shared experiences mean they're your family, perhaps the only family you've got.

characteristics.name: Exceptional
characteristics.description: +2 to your Might Pool and +2 to your Speed Pool.

characteristics.name: Distinctive Physical Quirk
characteristics.description: You have an unusual physical aspect. Depending on the setting, this can vary greatly; it might be something external and obvious, such as an odd smell or blue hair, or internal and hidden, like having blood type "omega." Whatever it is, your quirk draws a lot of attention when it's discovered.

characteristics.name: A Sense for the Weird
characteristics.description: Sometimes--at the GM's discretion--an event or person that seems related to your uncanny nature attracts your attention. You can sense it from afar, and if you get within long range of it, you can sense whether it is overtly dangerous or not.

characteristics.name: Skill
characteristics.description: You're trained in either perception tasks or stealth tasks.

characteristics.name: Skill
characteristics.description: You're trained in one kind of knowledge related to your quirk, such as olfactory science, mutations, or hematology.

characteristics.name: Inability
characteristics.description: People find you unnerving. All tasks relating to pleasant social interaction are hindered. (Other people who are unusual like you aren't affected by this.)

links: You felt the objective was someone like you, so you got involved.
Whether the other PCs realize it or not, their mission has to do with your field of knowledge, so you got involved.
As an expert in an unusual kind of knowledge, you were specifically recruited by the other PCs.
You believe one of the other PCs may be uncanny or is related to someone who is.

descriptors.name: VICIOUS
descriptors.description: You try to hide what's inside, fold it into yourself when everything inside you screams to let go, make them pay, make them hurt, and make them bleed. Sometimes you succeed for your friends-smiling like they smile, laughing when they laugh, and sometimes even having other emotions of your own. But it's always there, that feeling of frantic glee mixed with hate that sometimes leaps out of you when you confront a foe. Violence your friends can tolerate, but you sometimes worry they will also learn that you are cruel.

characteristics.name: Skill
characteristics.description: You are trained in tracking creatures. If a creature has wronged you, the tracking task is eased.

characteristics.name: Bloodthirsty
characteristics.description: Once you begin fighting, you see only red. You inflict 2 additional points of damage with any attack.

characteristics.name: Berserk
characteristics.description: Once you begin fighting, it's hard for you to stop. In fact, it's a difficulty 2 Intellect task to do so, even if your foe surrenders or you've run out of foes. If the latter occurs and you fail to stop, you attack the nearest ally within short range.

characteristics.name: Additional Equipment
characteristics.description: You have a record that you use to list those who've wronged you.

links: Another PC saw you take down a mean drunk in a tavern, not realizing you were the one who started the fight.
You wanted to get away from a bad situation, so you went with the other PCs.
You want to change, and you hope that being with the other PCs will help you calm yourself.
One of the other PCs asked you to come along, believing that your viciousness could be harnessed for the benefit of the mission.

descriptors.name: VIRTUOUS
descriptors.description: Doing the right thing is a way of life. You live by a code, and that code is something you attend to every day. Whenever you slip, you reproach yourself for your weakness and then get right back on track. Your code probably includes moderation, respect for others, cleanliness, and other characteristics that most people would agree are virtues, while you eschew their opposites: sloth, greed, gluttony, and so on.

characteristics.name: Dauntless
characteristics.description: +2 to your Might Pool.

characteristics.name: Skill
characteristics.description: You are trained in discerning people's true motives or seeing through lies.

characteristics.name: Skill
characteristics.description: Your adherence to a strict moral code has hardened your mind against fear, doubt, and outside influence. You are trained in Intellect defense tasks.

links: The PCs are doing something virtuous, and you're all about that.
The PCs are on the road to perdition, and you see it as your task to set them on the proper moral route.
One of the other PCs invited you, hearing of your virtuous ways.

You put virtue before sense and defended someone's honor in the face of an organization or power far greater than you. You joined the PCs because they offered aid and friendship when, out of fear of reprisals, no one else would.

descriptors.name: WEIRD
descriptors.description:
You aren't like anyone else, and that's fine with you. People don't seem to understand you-they even seem put off by you-but who cares? You understand the world better than they do because you're weird, and so is the world you live in. The concept of "the weird" is well known to you. Strange devices, ancient locales, bizarre creatures, storms that can transform you, living energy fields, conspiracies, aliens, and things most people can't even name populate the world, and you thrive on them. You have a special attachment to it all, and the more you discover about the weirdness in the world, the more you might discover about yourself.
Weird characters might be mutants or people born with strange qualities, but sometimes they started out "normal" and adopted the weird by choice.

characteristics.name: Inner Light
characteristics.description: +2 to your Intellect Pool.

characteristics.name: Distinctive Physical Quirk
characteristics.description: You have a unique physical aspect that is, well, bizarre. Depending on the setting, this can vary greatly. You might have purple hair or metal spikes on your head. Perhaps your hands don't connect to your arms, although they move as if they do. Maybe a third eye stares out from the side of your head, or superfluous tendrils grow from your back. Whatever it is, your quirk might be a mutation, a supernatural trait (a blessing or curse), a feature with no explanation, or just a really wild tattoo that draws a lot of attention.

characteristics.name: A Sense for the Weird
characteristics.description: Sometimes-at the GM's discretion-weird things relating to the supernatural or its effects on the world seem to call out to you. You can sense them from afar, and if you get within long range of such a thing, you can sense whether it is overtly dangerous or not.

characteristics.name: Skill
characteristics.description: You are trained in supernatural knowledge.

characteristics.name: Inability
characteristics.description: People find you unnerving. All tasks relating to pleasant social interaction are hindered.

links: It seemed weird, so why not?
Whether the other PCs realize it or not, their mission has to do with something weird that you know about, so you got involved.
As an expert in the weird, you were specifically recruited by the other PCs.
You felt drawn to join the other PCs, but you don't know why.

foci.name: ABIDES IN STONE
foci.description: Your flesh is made of hard mineral, making you a hulking, difficult-to-harm humanoid.
foci.intrusions: Creatures of stone sometimes forget their own strength or weight. A walking statue can terrify common folk.

foci.name: ABSORBS ENERGY
foci.description: You can harness kinetic energy and transform it into other kinds of energy.
foci.intrusions: Energy goes to ground in a destructive way. Some predators feed directly on energy. An unintended item is drained of energy.

foci.name: AWAKENS DREAMS
foci.description: You can pull images from dreams and bring them to life in the waking world.
foci.intrusions: An unexpected sleepwalking episode puts the character into a dangerous situation. A nightmare breaks free of a dream.

foci.name: BATTLES ROBOTS
foci.description: You excel in battling robots, automatons, and machine entities.
foci.intrusions: The robot explodes upon defeat. Other robots come after the character for revenge.

foci.name: BEARS A HALO OF FIRE
foci.description: You can sheath your body in flames, which protects you and harms your foes.
foci.intrusions: Fire burns flammable material. Fire spreads out of control. Primitive creatures fear fire and often attack what they fear.

foci.name: BLAZES WITH RADIANCE
foci.description: You can create light, sculpt it, bend it away from you, or gather it to use as a weapon.
foci.intrusions: Allies are accidentally dazzled or blinded. Bright flashes draw guards.

foci.name: BRANDISHES AN EXOTIC SHIELD
foci.description: You deploy an amazing shield of pure force that provides protection and some offensive options.
foci.intrusions: The shield is temporarily lost. A foe temporarily ends up with the shield.

foci.name: BUILDS ROBOTS
foci.description: Your robotic creations do as they are commanded.
foci.intrusions: The robot is hacked, gains a mind of its own, or unexpectedly detonates.

foci.name: CALCULATES THE INCALCULABLE
foci.description: Awesome mathematical ability allows you to model the world in real time, giving you an edge over everyone.
foci.intrusions: Too many predicted results threaten to overwhelm and stun the character. A result points to imminent disaster.

foci.name: CHANNELS DIVINE BLESSINGS
foci.description: A devout follower of a divine being, you channel some of your deity's power to achieve wonders.
foci.intrusions: A demon investigates divine magic use. A rival cult has issues with the character's teachings.

foci.name: COMMANDS MENTAL POWERS
foci.description: You have honed the power of your mind to perform amazing psychic deeds.
foci.intrusions: Something glimpsed in the target's mind is horrifying. A feedback loop allows the target to read the character's mind.

foci.name: CONDUCTS WEIRD SCIENCE
foci.description: Your preternatural insight and ability make you a scientist capable of amazing feats.
foci.intrusions: Creations get out of control. Side effects cannot always be predicted. Weird science terrifies people and can draw the media. When a device created or modified by weird science is depleted, it detonates.

foci.name: CONSORTS WITH THE DEAD
foci.description: The dead answer your questions, and their reanimated corpses serve you.
foci.intrusions: The character's necromantic reputation precedes them. A corpse seeks revenge for being reanimated.

foci.name: CONTROLS BEASTS
foci.description: Your ability to communicate and lead beasts is uncanny.
foci.intrusions: The community is reluctant to welcome dangerous animals. Out-of-control beasts become a real hazard.

foci.name: CONTROLS GRAVITY
foci.description: You can sway the attraction of gravity itself.
foci.intrusions: Onlookers react with unreasoning fear. A weird interaction sends an ally or object careening into the sky.

foci.name: COPIES SUPERPOWERS
foci.description: You can copy others' skills, abilities, and superpowers.
foci.intrusions: A copied power ends unexpectedly or goes out of control. A copied power doesn't bring secondary powers with it (like gaining superspeed without protection from air friction, or not being immune to the heat from your own fire bolts).

foci.name: CRAFTS ILLUSIONS
foci.description: You fashion images from light that are so perfect they seem real.
foci.intrusions: The illusion isn't believable. The illusion is pierced at just the wrong moment.

foci.name: CRAFTS UNIQUE OBJECTS
foci.description: You're an inventor of strange and useful objects.
foci.intrusions: The object malfunctions, breaks, or suffers catastrophic or unexpected failure.

foci.name: DANCES WITH DARK MATTER
foci.description: You can manipulate shadow and "dark" matter.
foci.intrusions: Dark matter skulks away as if possessed by a mind of its own.

foci.name: DEFENDS THE GATE
foci.description: Everyone wants you on their side when it comes to a fight because nothing gets by you.
foci.intrusions: A strategically important structure collapses. The enemy attacks from an unexpected direction.

foci.name: DEFENDS THE WEAK
foci.description: You stand up for the helpless, the weak, and the unprotected.
foci.intrusions: A character focused on protecting others may periodically leave themselves vulnerable to attacks.

foci.name: DESCENDS FROM NOBILITY
foci.description: A descendent of wealth and power, you carry a noble title and the abilities granted by a privileged upbringing.
foci.intrusions: Debts incurred by a family are owed by the character. A long-lost sibling seeks to disinherit rivals. An assassin finds the character.

foci.name: DOESN'T DO MUCH
foci.description: You're a slacker, but you know a little about a lot of things.
foci.intrusions: New situations are confounding and stressful. Past actions (or inactions) come back to haunt the character.

foci.name: DRIVES LIKE A MANIAC
foci.description: Whether balancing on two wheels, jumping another vehicle, or driving head-on toward an oncoming enemy car, you don't think about the risks when you're behind the wheel.
foci.intrusions: The engine develops a knock. The bridge on the road ahead is out. The windshield shatters. Someone unexpectedly runs in front of the vehicle.

foci.name: EMERGED FROM THE OBELISK
foci.description: Your body, hard as crystal, gives you a suite of unique abilities, gained after an interaction with a floating crystalline obelisk.
foci.intrusions: Cyphers and artifacts react unexpectedly in the character's hands.

foci.name: EMPLOYS MAGNETISM
foci.description: You command metal and the power of magnetism.
foci.intrusions: The metal twists, bends, or produces shrapnel. A lapse in concentration might cause something to slip or drop at just the wrong time.

foci.name: ENTERTAINS
foci.description: You perform, mostly for the benefit of others.
foci.intrusions: The audience is annoyed or offended. Musical instruments break. Paints dry in their pots. The words to a poem or song are forgotten.

foci.name: EXISTS IN TWO PLACES AT ONCE
foci.description: You exist in two places at once.
foci.intrusions: Perceiving the world from two different places disorients the character, causing momentary vertigo, nausea, or confusion.

foci.name: EXISTS PARTIALLY OUT OF PHASE
foci.description: A bit translucent, you're slightly out of phase and can move through solid objects.
foci.intrusions: The character is sent phasing into an unexpected dimension. The character becomes lost in a large solid.

foci.name: EXPLORES DARK PLACES
foci.description: You're the archetypal treasure hunter, scavenger, and finder of lost things.
foci.intrusions: Possessions fall out of pockets or bags in the dark; maps get lost; information gained fails to include an important detail.

foci.name: FIGHTS DIRTY
foci.description: You'll do anything to win a fight: bite, scratch, kick, trick, and worse.
foci.intrusions: People look poorly upon those who cheat or fight without honor. Sometimes a dirty trick backfires.

foci.name: FIGHTS WITH PANACHE
foci.description: You're a swashbuckling daredevil who fights with flamboyant style that's entertaining to watch.
foci.intrusions: The display comes off looking silly, clumsy, or unattractive.

foci.name: FLIES FASTER THAN A BULLET
foci.description: You can fly, and you're superstrong, hard to hurt, and fast too. Is there anything you can't do?
foci.intrusions: A nemesis finds the character. A strange material is found to nullify the character's abilities.

foci.name: FOCUSES MIND OVER MATTER
foci.description: You can telekinetically move objects with your mind without physically touching them.
foci.intrusions: One mental slip, and moving objects drop or fragile objects break. Sometimes the wrong item moves, falls, or breaks.

foci.name: FUSES FLESH AND STEEL
foci.description: Your body is part machine.
foci.intrusions: People in most societies are afraid of someone who is revealed to have mechanical parts.

foci.name: FUSES MIND AND MACHINE
foci.description: Electronic aids implanted in your brain make you a mental powerhouse.
foci.intrusions: Machines malfunction and shut down. Powerful machine intelligences can take control of lesser thinking machines. Some people don't trust a person who isn't fully organic.

foci.name: GROWS TO TOWERING HEIGHTS
foci.description: For brief periods, you can grow larger and, with enough experience, to towering heights.
foci.intrusions: Rapid growth knocks over furnishings or smashes through ceilings or hanging lights. An enlarged character breaks through the floor.

foci.name: HAS A THOUSAND FACES
foci.description: You can change your appearance to look like anyone else.
foci.intrusions: Part of the disguise slips. An NPC thinks the disguised character is someone they know very well.

foci.name: HELPS THEIR FRIENDS
foci.description: You love your friends and help them out of any difficulty, no matter what.
foci.intrusions: Others sometimes have ulterior motives. The law takes an undue interest. Even when everything goes right, repercussions follow.

foci.name: HOWLS AT THE MOON
foci.description: For brief periods, you become a fearsome and powerful creature with control issues.
foci.intrusions: The change happens in an uncontrolled fashion. People are terrified of monsters.

foci.name: HUNTS
foci.description: You are a stalking hunter who excels at bringing down your selected quarry.
foci.intrusions: The quarry notices the character. The quarry isn't as vulnerable as it seemed.

foci.name: IGNORES PHYSICAL DISTANCE
foci.description: You can teleport from one place to another by briefly passing through a parallel dimension.
foci.intrusions: A teleport goes awry, landing the character in a dangerous place. Inertia (such as from falling) continues through the teleport, injuring the character.

foci.name: INFILTRATES
foci.description: Subtlety, guile, and stealth allow you to get in where others can't.
foci.intrusions: Spies are treated harshly when caught. Allies disavow infiltrators who get caught. Some secrets are better left unknown.

foci.name: INTERPRETS THE LAW
foci.description: You excel at winning others over to your views.
foci.intrusions: Onlookers react badly to a know-it-all. A distraction or interruption throws the character's argument off the rails.

foci.name: IS IDOLIZED BY MILLIONS
foci.description: You're a celebrity and most people adore you.

abilities.name: Do You Know Who I Am?

foci.intrusions: Fans are endangered or hurt on your behalf. Someone in your entourage betrays you. Your show, tour, contract, or other event is canceled. The media posts photos of you in an embarrassing situation.

foci.name: IS LICENSED TO CARRY
foci.description: You carry a gun and you know how to use it in a fight.
foci.intrusions: Misfire or jam! The attack fails and the action is lost, plus an additional action is needed to fix the problem.

foci.name: IS WANTED BY THE LAW
foci.description: "WANTED, DEAD OR ALIVE" posters (or their equivalent) have appeared featuring your face. It's up to you whether it's a mistake that snowballed out of control or you actually would kill someone just for looking at you.
foci.intrusions: Most people do not take well to discovering a wanted outlaw in their midst.

foci.name: KEEPS A MAGIC ALLY
foci.description: An allied magic creature bound to an object (such as a minor djinn in a lamp, or a ghost in a pipe) is your friend, protector, and weapon.
foci.intrusions: The creature unexpectedly disappears into its bound object. The bound object cracks. The creature disagrees and doesn't do as asked. The creature says it's leaving unless a task is performed for it.

foci.name: LEADS
foci.description: Your natural leadership capability allows you to command others, including a loyal band of followers.
foci.intrusions: Followers fail, betray, lie, become corrupted, get kidnapped, or die.

foci.name: LEARNS QUICKLY
foci.description: You deal with bad situations as they arise, learning new lessons each time.
foci.intrusions: Accidents and mistakes are great teachers.

foci.name: LIVES IN THE WILDERNESS
foci.description: You can survive in badlands where others perish.

abilities.name: The Wild Is on Your Side

foci.intrusions: People in cities and towns sometimes disparage those who look (and smell) like they live in the wilds, as if they were ignorant or barbaric.

foci.name: LOOKS FOR TROUBLE
foci.description: You're a scrapper and love a good fight.
foci.intrusions: Weapons break or fly from even the strongest grip. Brawlers trip and fall. Even the battlefield can work against you with things falling or collapsing.

foci.name: LOVES THE VOID
foci.description: When it's just you, your spacesuit, and the panorama of stars wheeling out forever and always, you are at peace.
foci.intrusions: Spacesuits develop glitches. Air refill cartridges sometimes misreport capacity. Micrometeorites are common in space.

foci.name: MASTERS DEFENSE
foci.description: You use protective equipment and practiced techniques to avoid becoming hurt in a fight.
foci.intrusions: Shields break when hit, as do weapons used to parry. Armor straps break.

foci.name: MASTERS SPELLS
foci.description: By specializing in spellcasting and keeping a spellbook, you can quickly cast spells of arcing lightning, rolling fire, creeping shadow, and summoning.
foci.intrusions: The spell goes wrong. The summoned creature turns on the caster. A rival spellcaster is drawn to the magic use.

foci.name: MASTERS THE SWARM
foci.description: Insects. Rats. Bats. Even birds. You master one type of small creature that obeys you.
foci.intrusions: A command is misunderstood. Control is erratic or is lost. Bites and stings are not uncommon for masters of the swarm.

foci.name: MASTERS WEAPONRY
foci.description: You are a master user of a particular type of weapon, be it a sword, whip, dagger, gun, or something else.
foci.intrusions: Weapons break. Weapons can be stolen. Weapons can be dropped or forced out of your hand.

foci.name: METES OUT JUSTICE
foci.description: You right wrongs, protect the innocent, and punish the guilty.
foci.intrusions: Guilt or innocence can be complicated. Some people resent the presumption of a self-appointed judge. Passing judgment makes enemies.

foci.name: MOVES LIKE A CAT
foci.description: Lithe, flexible, and graceful, you move quickly and smoothly, and never seem to be where danger is.
foci.intrusions: Even a cat can be clumsy. A jump isn't quite as easy as it looks. An escape move is so overzealous that it sends the character right into harm's way.

foci.name: MOVES LIKE THE WIND
foci.description: You can move so fast that you become a blur.
foci.intrusions: Surfaces can be slick or offer hidden obstacles. The movement of other creatures can be unpredictable, and the character might run into them.

foci.name: MURDERS
foci.description: You're an assassin, whether by trade, by inclination, or because it was that or be killed yourself. (Someone who Murders might have additional equipment, including three doses of a level 2 blade poison that inflicts 5 points of damage.)
foci.intrusions: Most people do not react well to a professional killer.

foci.name: NEEDS NO WEAPON
foci.description: Powerful punches, kicks, elbows, knees, and full body movements are all the weapons you need.
foci.intrusions: Striking certain foes hurts you as much as it hurts them. Opponents with weapons have greater reach. Complicated martial arts moves can knock you off balance.

foci.name: NEVER SAYS DIE
foci.description: You never quit, can shrug off a beating, and always come back for more.
foci.intrusions: Sometimes, it's equipment or weapons that give out.

foci.name: OPERATES UNDERCOVER
foci.description: Under the guise of someone else, you seek to find answers the powerful do not want divulged.
foci.intrusions: Bad luck can ruin the best plans. Disguises fail. Allies are revealed to be agents, too.

foci.name: PERFORMS FEATS OF STRENGTH
foci.description: A muscled prodigy, you can haul incredible weight, hurl your body through the air, and punch through doors.
foci.intrusions: It's easy to break delicate things or hurt someone accidentally.

foci.name: PILOTS STARCRAFT
foci.description: You're a crack starship pilot.

abilities.name: Like the Back of Your Hand

foci.intrusions: Starcraft get lost, break down, and are attacked in space. An alien stowaway is found.

foci.name: PLAYS TOO MANY GAMES
foci.description: Lessons, reflexes, and strategies you've learned by playing too many games have applications in the real world, where people who don't play enough toil and live their dreary lives.
foci.intrusions: Missed attacks strike the wrong target. Equipment breaks. Sometimes people react negatively to someone who has lived most of their life in imaginary game worlds.

foci.name: RAGES
foci.description: When you go berserk, everyone fears you.
foci.intrusions: It's easy for a berserker to lose control and attack friend as well as foe.

foci.name: RIDES THE LIGHTNING
foci.description: You create and discharge electrical power.
foci.intrusions: Targets other than those intended are shocked. Objects explode.

foci.name: RUNS AWAY
foci.description: Your first instinct is to run from danger, and you've gotten very good at it.
foci.intrusions: Quick movements sometimes lead to dropped items, slipping on uneven ground, or going the wrong way by accident.

foci.name: SAILED BENEATH THE JOLLY ROGER
foci.description: You sailed with a crew of dread pirates, but you've decided to end your days as a pirate and join some other cause. The question is, will your past let you go so easily?
foci.intrusions: The dangers of the high seas are many, including severe storms and disease. Other pirates sometimes get ahead through betrayal. A pirate tracks down former sailing mates to find hidden treasure.

foci.name: SCAVENGES
foci.description: When not running and hiding, you sift the ruins of civilization for useful remnants to ensure your survival.
foci.intrusions: An item made with recycled junk breaks. Someone shows up claiming that the useful item or piece of junk scavenged belongs to them. A recycled cypher explodes.

foci.name: SCULPTS HARD LIGHT
foci.description: You create physical objects out of hard light that you can use for offense and defense.
foci.intrusions: A hard light object disappears early. A hard light object cannot affect a certain creature or color.

foci.name: SEES BEYOND
foci.description: You have a psychic sense that allows you to see what others cannot.
foci.intrusions: Some secrets are too terrible to know.

foci.name: SEPARATES MIND FROM BODY
foci.description: You can project your mind out of your body to see faraway places and learn secrets that would otherwise remain hidden.
foci.intrusions: Reuniting mind and body can sometimes be disorienting and require a character to spend a few moments to get their bearings.

foci.name: SHEPHERDS SPIRITS
foci.description: Wandering souls, nature spirits, and elemental beings aid and support you.
foci.intrusions: Some people don't trust those who deal with spirits. The dead sometimes don't want shepherding.

foci.name: SHEPHERDS THE COMMUNITY
foci.description: You keep the place where you live safe from all danger.
foci.intrusions: People in the community misunderstand the character's motives. Rivals try to oust the character.

foci.name: SHREDS THE WALLS OF THE WORLD
foci.description: Speed plus phasing gives you a unique ability to evade danger and simultaneously inflict damage.
foci.intrusions: Moving so quickly while sprinting sometimes leads to stumbles on unexpected, exotic obstacles.

foci.name: SHRINKS TO MINUTE SIZE
foci.description: You can shrink down to the size of a bug and, with enough experience, even smaller. (A character who Shrinks to Minute Size who chooses to learn abilities like Enlarge will never be quite as big as one who Grows to Towering Heights, but they can enjoy the advantages of being big or small as needed.)
foci.intrusions: A creature thinks the small character is potential food. The small character gets trapped in a tiny space or under a falling object.

foci.name: SIPHONS POWER
foci.description: You suck power out of machines and creatures alike in order to empower yourself.
foci.intrusions: Drained power also transmits something unwanted-compulsions, afflictions, or alien thoughts. Siphoned power can overload the character, causing feedback.

foci.name: SLAYS MONSTERS
foci.description: You kill monsters.
foci.intrusions: The monster laid a trap or set an ambush. The monster has previously undisclosed abilities. The monster's mother vows revenge.

foci.name: SOARS ON AMAZING WINGS
foci.description: Many superheroes can fly, and some even have wings. You can use your wings for movement, attacks, and defense.
foci.intrusions: A wing gets hurt or restrained, causing the character to fall. Flying high makes the character an obvious target for an unexpected foe.

foci.name: SOLVES MYSTERIES
foci.description: You're a master of deduction, using evidence to find the answer.
foci.intrusions: Evidence disappears, red herrings confuse, and witnesses lie. Initial research can be faulty.

foci.name: SPEAKS FOR THE LAND
foci.description: Your spiritual connection to nature and the environment grants you mystical abilities.
foci.intrusions: An injured natural (but dangerous) creature is discovered. Someone's poaching wildlife for their skins, leaving the carcasses to rot. A tree falls in the forest, one of the last elder trees.

foci.name: STANDS LIKE A BASTION
foci.description: Your armor, along with your size, strength, incredible training, or machine enhancement, makes you difficult to move or hurt.
foci.intrusions: Armor is damaged. Small foes conspire in ingenious ways.

foci.name: STRETCHES
foci.description: Your body is elastic and rubbery, able to stretch to great lengths and compress when struck.
foci.intrusions: An attack or effect interferes with the character's elasticity. A stretched limb becomes overstressed and weak.

foci.name: TAKES ANIMAL SHAPE
foci.description: A shapechanger who can take the form of various animals.
foci.intrusions: The character unexpectedly changes form. An NPC is frightened by or aggressive toward the shapeshifter. The transformation takes longer than expected.

foci.name: TALKS TO MACHINES
foci.description: You use your organic brain like a computer, interfacing "wirelessly" with any electronic device. You can control and influence them in ways that others can't.
foci.intrusions: The machine malfunctions or acts unpredictably.

foci.name: THROWS WITH DEADLY ACCURACY
foci.description: Everything that leaves your hand goes exactly where you'd like it to go and at the range and speed to make the perfect impact.
foci.intrusions: Missed attacks strike the wrong target. Ricochets can be dangerous. Improvised weapons break.

foci.name: THUNDERS
foci.description: You emit destructive sound and manipulate soundscapes.
foci.intrusions: Loud noises attract attention.

foci.name: TOUCHES THE SKY
foci.description: You can summon storms or break them apart.
foci.intrusions: An ally is accidentally struck by a fork of lightning. An unexpected grounding effect inflicts damage. The weather is seeded by a much smaller effect, and a storm grows out of control.

foci.name: TRAVELS THROUGH TIME
foci.description: You can see through time, try to reach through it, and eventually even travel through it.
foci.intrusions: Paradoxes are created. Others remember past events differently.

foci.name: USES WILD MAGIC
foci.description: spellcaster who learns a variety of spells instead of focusing on just one kind of magic.
foci.intrusions: A spell performs erratically or rebounds upon the caster. Something interferes with preparing spells. Spellcasting attracts the attention of a powerful creature or potential rival. The cypher spell being cast is replaced with that of a random cypher.

foci.name: WALKS THE WILD WOODS
foci.description: An adherent of nature magic who draws on the power and strength of trees.
foci.intrusions: A wooden character catches fire. A wild swing from a tree branch hits or trips an ally. Some trees have evil hearts and hate all walking things.

foci.name: WAS FORETOLD
foci.description: You are the "chosen one," and prophecy, prediction, prognostication, or some other method of determination expects great things of you one day.
foci.intrusions: An enemy described in prophecy appears. Unbelievers threaten to ruin the moment. The character gains a reputation in outside circles as a fraud.

foci.name: WEARS A SHEEN OF ICE
foci.description: You command the wintery power of cold and ice.
foci.intrusions: Ice makes surfaces slippery. Extreme cold causes objects to crack and break.

foci.name: WEARS POWER ARMOR
foci.description: Tier 1: Powered Armor
foci.intrusions: The armor won't come off. The armor acts under its own power. The armor suffers a momentary power loss. NPCs are scared by the power armor.

foci.name: WIELDS AN ENCHANTED WEAPON
foci.description: You have a weapon with strange abilities, and your knowledge of its powers has allowed you to create a unique style of combat with it.
foci.intrusions: A weapon breaks or is dropped. The character loses their connection to the weapon until they use an action to reestablish the attunement. The weapon's energy discharges in an unexpected way.

foci.name: WIELDS INVISIBLE FORCE
foci.description: You bend light and manipulate beams of force for offense and defense.
foci.intrusions: Invisibility partially fades, revealing the character's presence. A force field is pierced by an unusual or unexpected attack.

foci.name: WIELDS TWO WEAPONS AT ONCE
foci.description: You bear steel with both hands, ready to take on any foe.
foci.intrusions: A blade snaps in two or a weapon flies loose from its bearer's grip.

foci.name: WORKS FOR A LIVING
foci.description: You take great satisfaction in a job well done, whether it's coding, building houses, or mining asteroids.
foci.intrusions: Repairs sometimes fail. Wiring can be tricky to decipher and still carry an electrical charge. Some people are rude to those who work for a living.

foci.name: WORKS MIRACLES
foci.description: You can heal others with a touch, alter time to help others, and are generally beloved by everyone.
foci.intrusions: Attempts to heal might cause harm instead. A community or individual needs a healer so desperately that they hold one against their will.

foci.name: WORKS THE BACK ALLEYS
foci.description: You make your way unseen, stealing from the wealthy to achieve your ends.
foci.intrusions: Thieves are thrown in jail. Powerful enemies are made.

foci.name: WORKS THE SYSTEM
foci.description: You can exploit flaws in artificial systems, including but not limited to computer code.
foci.intrusions: Contacts sometimes have ulterior motives. Devices sometimes have failsafes or even traps.

foci.name: WOULD RATHER BE READING
foci.description: Books are your friends. What's more important than knowledge? Nothing.
foci.intrusions: Books burn, get wet, or get lost. Computers break or lose power. Glasses break.

abilities.name: A Smile and a Word
abilities.description: When you use Effort on any action involving interactions-even those having to do with calming animals or communicating with someone or something whose language you do not speak-you gain a free level of Effort on the task. Action.

abilities.name: Able Assistance
abilities.description: When you help someone with a task and they apply a level of Effort, they get a free level of Effort on that task. Enabler.

abilities.name: Absorb Energy
abilities.description: You touch an object and absorb its energy. If you touch a manifest cypher, you render it useless. If you touch an artifact, roll for its depletion. If you touch another kind of powered machine or device, the GM determines whether its power is fully drained. In any case, you absorb energy from the object touched and regain 1d10 Intellect points. If this would give you more Intellect than your Pool's maximum, the extra points are lost, and you must make a Might defense roll. The difficulty of the roll is equal to the number of points over your maximum you absorbed. If you fail the roll, you take 5 points of damage and are unable to act for one round. You can use this ability as a defense action when you're the target of an incoming ability. Doing so cancels the incoming ability, and you absorb the energy as if it were a device. Action.

abilities.name: Absorb Kinetic Energy
abilities.description: You absorb a portion of the energy of a physical attack or impact. You negate 1 point of damage you would have suffered and store that point as energy. Once you have absorbed 1 point of energy, you continue to negate 1 point of damage from any incoming blow or impact, but the residual energy bleeds off with a flare of harmless light (you cannot store more than 1 point at a time). Enabler.

abilities.name: Absorb Pure Energy
abilities.description: When you use Absorb Kinetic Energy, you can also absorb and store energy from attacks made with pure energy (focused light, radiation, transdimensional, psychic, etc.) or from conduits that direct energy, if you can make direct contact. This ability does not change how many points of energy you can store. If you also have Improved Absorb Kinetic Energy, you can absorb 2 points of damage from other energy sources as well. Enabler.

abilities.name: Accelerate
abilities.description: Your words imbue the spirit of a character within immediate range who is able to understand you, accelerating them so they gain an asset on initiative tasks and Speed defense rolls for ten minutes. In addition to the normal options for using Effort, you can choose to use Effort to affect more targets; each level of Effort affects one additional target. You must speak to additional targets to accelerate them, one target per round. Action per target to initiate.

abilities.name: Acrobatic Attack
abilities.description: You leap into the attack, twisting or flipping through the air. If you roll a natural 17 or 18, you can choose to have a minor effect rather than deal extra damage. If you apply Effort to the attack, you get a free level of Effort on the task. You can't use this ability if your Speed Effort costs are reduced from wearing armor. Enabler.

abilities.name: Action Processor
abilities.description: Drawing upon stored information and the ability to process incoming data at amazing speeds, you are trained in one physical task of your choice for ten minutes. For example, you can choose running, climbing, swimming, Speed defense, or attacks with a specific weapon. Action to initiate.

abilities.name: Adaptation
abilities.description: Thanks to a latent mutation, a device implanted in your spine, a ritual performed with dragon's blood, or some other gift, you now remain at a comfortable temperature; never need to worry about dangerous radiation, diseases, or gases; and can always breathe in any environment (even the vacuum of space). Enabler.

abilities.name: Adroit Cypher Use
abilities.description: You can bear four cyphers at a time. Enabler.

abilities.name: Advanced Command
abilities.description: A target within short range obeys any command you give as long as they can hear and understand you. Further, as long as you continue to do nothing but issue commands (taking no other action), you can give that same target a new command. This effect ends when you stop issuing commands or they are out of short range. Action to initiate.

abilities.name: Advantage to Disadvantage
abilities.description: With a number of quick moves, you make an attack against an armed foe, inflicting damage and disarming them so that their weapon is now in your hands or 10 feet (3 m) away on the ground-your choice. This disarming attack is hindered. Action.

abilities.name: Advantages of Being Big
abilities.description: When you use Enlarge, you're so big that you can move massive objects more easily, climb buildings by using hand- and footholds unavailable to regular-sized people, and jump much farther.
